N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4244.1 - Purpose and general description

State Regulations

The purpose of these regulations is to set forth the
framework for the administration of the Metropolitan Economic Revitalization

Fund (herein referred to as the "fund" or the "program") by the New York State

Urban Development Corporation d/b/a the Empire State Development Corporation
("ESDC" or the "corporation"). These regulations codify the administration of
the fund, determine eligibility, and set forth the evaluation criteria and
application process. The program is intended to fund public/private partnerships
in economic development projects that create and/or retain substantial jobs
specifically within the geographic area known as the New York portion of the
service area of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey. The program is
further intended to promote projects which will increase business activity
within the region, create new sustainable physical development, and stimulate
related economic growth in the surrounding community. The purpose of the
program is to establish a revolving loan fund that provides assistance to
bridge financing gaps in the financial structure of proposed projects. The
program will fund projects that already have substantial private sector
investment that attract investors and lenders to the proposed project and
surrounding community. Notes
